definitions.definition: The act of abrading , wearing, or rubbing off; the wearing away by friction.
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the mid 17 century.

definitions.definition: The substance thus rubbed off; debris .
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the mid 18 century.

definitions.definition: The effect of mechanical erosion of rock, especially a river bed, by rock fragments scratching and scraping it.
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the mid 19 century.

definitions.definition: An abraded, scraped, or worn area.
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the mid 20 century.

definitions.definition: A superficial wound caused by scraping; an area of skin where the cells on the surface have been scraped or worn away.
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the mid 20 century.

definitions.definition: The wearing away of the surface of the tooth by chewing.

main_definition: The act of abrading , wearing, or rubbing off; the wearing away by friction. [First attested in the mid 17 century.]
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete ) The substance thus rubbed off; debris . [First attested in the mid 18 century.]
( geology ) The effect of mechanical erosion of rock, especially a river bed, by rock fragments scratching and scraping it. [First attested in the mid 19 century.]
An abraded, scraped, or worn area. [First attested in the mid 20 century.]
( medicine ) A superficial wound caused by scraping; an area of skin where the cells on the surface have been scraped or worn away. [First attested in the mid 20 century.]
( dentistry ) The wearing away of the surface of the tooth by chewing.
